intro: Homalobus inversus, commonly known as the upside-down plant, is a unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its distinctive growth pattern, with stems and leaves oriented downward, giving it its common name. Its small, tubular flowers are typically yellow or orange, and they bloom in the early morning. Due to its rare and unusual appearance, it is a sought-after species among botanists and plant enthusiasts.
